box.text: Ride (DEX) The character is skilled at riding mounts, usually a horse, but possibly something more exotic, like an elephant or camel.

item.text: The character can react instantly to guide their mount with theirknees so that the character can use both hands in combat or to perform some other action. Make the check at the start of the character's round. If the character fails, they can only use one hand this round because the character needs to use the other to control their mount.
The character can react instantly to try to avoid falling whentheir mount rears or bolts unexpectedly or when the character takes damage.

While in combat, the character can attempt to control a mountthat is not trained in combat riding. If the character succeeds they use only 6 Combat Points and the character can use their remaining Combat Points to do something else. If the character fails, they can do nothing else that round. If the character fails by more than 5, they lose control of the animal.
For animals trained in combat riding, the character does notPoints to have the animal perform a trick (commonly, to attack). The character can use the rest of their Combat Points normally.

The character can react instantly to drop down and hang alongsidetheir mount, using it as Â½ cover. The character can't attack while using their mount as cover. If the character fails, they don't get the cover benefit.
The character reacts instantly when they fall off a mount, suchas when it is killed or when it falls, to try to avoid taking damage. If the character fails, they take 1d6 points of fall damage.

The character can get their mount to leap obstacles as part ofits movement. Use the character's Ride modifier or the mount's Athletics modifier (whichever is lower) when the mount makes its Athletics check. The character makes a TN15 Ride check to stay on the mount when it leaps.
